subject: Data
title: What Makes Data 'Big'?
description: Learn What Makes Data 'Big'? in one minute.

hook.text: A single self-driving car generates 4 terabytes of data per day. That's more than most companies store.

buildup.text: Big data isn't just 'a lot of data.' It's data too large or complex for traditional tools to handle.

discovery.text: The term was coined in the 1990s when scientists hit the limits of what spreadsheets could process.

twist.text: What counts as 'big' keeps shifting. A gigabyte was big in 2000. Now we measure in exabytes.

climax.text: Big data is defined not by a number, but by the point where your current tools break down.

punchline.text: Big data is whatever your spreadsheet can't handle.

quiz.question: What defines data as 'big data'?
options: Data too large or complex for traditional tools
